convert-functions.pl

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #! /usr/bin/perl
00002 
00003 #
00004 # Usage:  convert-functions [-t | --test] [-q | --quiet] filename [filename ...]
00005 #
00006 #  If the filename is '-', act as a filter (read from stdin and write to stdout),
00007 #  otherwise, each file is read and modified.
00008 #
00009 #  If --test is specified, then no output is written, but you just see what changes
00010 #    would have been made.
00011 #
00012 #  If --quiet is specified, the conversions are not printed out
00013 #    (but the file names still are)
00014 #
00015 
00016 #
00017 #  The functions to be converted and their parameter lists.
00018 #
00019 #  The hash key is the original function name, and the value is an array of two or three items:
00020 #    The first is the name of the routine it is being mapped to
00021 #    The second is an array that tells how to map the original functions parameters to the
00022 #      new functions hash list (see below)
00023 #    The third is an optional hash of parameters that are always passed to the new routine
00024 #
00025 #  The values in the array of arguments have several special interpretations:
00026 #    A value listed as "undef" will be passed to the new routine as a plain argument (not as
00027 #      part of the hash).
00028 #    An entry of the form name[n] (where n is a number) will be put in position n of an array
00029 #      reference whose key is name in the hash passed to the new routine.  (E.g., "limits[0]"
00030 #      puts the argument in that position of the original argument list into the first entry
00031 #      of limits=>[n,m] in the hash.)  The default value for the array hash is given by
00032 #      the variable $default{name}, e.g. $default{limits} = ['$funcLLimitDefault','$funcULimitDefault'].
00033 #   An entry of '@' means make the rest of the parameters into an array reference and pass them
00034 #      as the first parameter to the new routine.
00035 #
00036 #   Any extra parameters from the original routine are passed verbatim to the new one.
00037 #
00038 
00039 %function = (
00040   std_num_cmp             => ['num_cmp',[undef,'relTol','format','zeroLevel','zeroLevelTol']],
00041   std_num_cmp_abs         => ['num_cmp',[undef,'tol','format'],{tolType=>'absolute'}],
00042   std_num_cmp_list        => ['num_cmp',['relTol','format','@']],
00043   std_num_cmp_abs_list    => ['num_cmp',['tol','format','@'],{tolType=>'absolute'}],

00078

00080   std_str_cmp_list          => ['str_cmp',['@']],
00081   std_cs_str_cmp            => ['str_cmp',[],{filters=>['trim_whitespace','compress_whitespace']}],
00082   std_cs_str_cmp_list       => ['str_cmp',['@'],{filters=>['trim_whitespace','compress_whitespace']}],

00096 #numerical_compare_with_units() needs to be handled by hand -- but there are very few uses.
00097 
00098 $default{limits} = ['$funcLLimitDefault','$funcULimitDefault'];
00099 
00100 #
00101 #  Make a patter from all the names (we sort be length of the names, to 
00102 #  make sure prefixes appear later in the list).
00103 #
00104 $pattern = join("|",sort byName keys(%function));
00105 
00106 sub byName {
00107   return $a <=> $b if length($a) == length($b);
00108   return length($b) <=> length($a);
00109 }
00110 
00111 #
00112 #  Remove leading and trailing spaces
00113 #
00114 sub trim {
00115   my $s = shift;
00116   $s =~ s/(^\s+|\s+$)//g;
00117   return $s;
00118 }
00119 
00120 #
00121 #  Remove leading comment lines
00122 #
00123 sub trimComments {
00124   my $s = shift;
00125   $s =~ s/^(\s*#.*?(\n|$))*//;
00126         return $s;
00127 }
00128 
00129 
00130 #
00131 #  Command-line options and internal state parameters
00132 #
00133 $testing = 0;  # true if not writing output files
00134 $quiet = 0;    # true if not printing changed function calls
00135 $changed = 0;  # true if we have changes a function in the current file
00136 
00137 #
00138 #  Read the contents of a file, and search through it for the functions
00139 #  above.  Then modify the argument lists to use hashes rather than
00140 #  direct parameter lists.
00141 #
00142 sub Process {
00143   my @lines;
00144   if ($file eq "-") {
00145     @lines = <>;
00146     open(PGFILE,">&STDOUT");  # redirect this to STDOUT
00147   } elsif ($file eq "--test" || $file eq "-t") {
00148     $testing = 1; return;
00149   } elsif ($file eq "--quiet" || $file eq "-q") {
00150     $quiet = 1; return;
00151   } else {
00152     print stderr "\n" if $changed;
00153     print stderr "Converting: $file\n";
00154     open(PGFILE,$file) || warn "Can't read '$file': $!";
00155     @lines = <PGFILE>; close(PGFILE);
00156     open(PGFILE,$testing? ">/dev/null": ">$file");
00157   }
00158   $changed = 0;
00159 
00160   my $file = join("",@lines);
00161   $file =~ s/\&beginproblem(\(\))?/beginproblem()/gm;  # remove unneeded ampersands
00162   $file =~ s/\&ANS\(/ANS\(/gm;  # remove unneeded ampersands
00163   $file =~ s/ANS\( */ANS\(/gm;  # remove unneeded spaces
00164   my @parts = split(/($pattern)/o,$file);
00165 #
00166 #  Because of the parentheses around the pattern above, split returns the pattern
00167 #  as well as the stuff it separates.  So @parts contains stuff, first function,
00168 #  args and more stuff, next function, etc.
00169 #
00170   print PGFILE shift(@parts);
00171   while (my $f = shift(@parts)) {
00172     my ($args,$rest) = GetArgs(shift(@parts));
00173     unless ($args) {print $f,$rest; next};  # skip it if doesn't look like an actual call
00174     print PGFILE HandleFunction($f,$function{$f},$args),$rest;
00175   }
00176 }
00177 
00178 #
00179 #  Convert the list of arguments to appropriate hash values
00180 #  (taking into account the interpretations given above
00181 #  for the special entries in the list).
00182 #  Don't include empty parameters (I don't think this should be a problem).
00183 #  Return the modified function call with the new name and hash
00184 #
00185 sub HandleFunction {
00186   my $original = shift; my $f = shift; my $args = shift;
00187   my @names = @{$f->[1]}; my @args = @{$args};
00188   my ($name,$value);
00189   #
00190   #  Get the fixed options needed for this function
00191   #
00192   my %options = %{$f->[2] || {}};
00193   foreach my $id (keys(%options)) {
00194     if (ref($options{$id}) eq 'ARRAY') {
00195       $options{$id} = '["'.join('","',@{$options{$id}}).'"]';
00196     } else {
00197       $options{$id} = '"'.$options{$id}.'"';
00198     }
00199   }
00200   #
00201   #  Process the list of arguments supplied by the user
00202   #    (treating special cases properly)
00203   #
00204   my @options = (); my @params = ();
00205   while (my ($name,$value) = (shift(@names),shift(@args))) {
00206     last unless defined $value;
00207     unless ($name) {push(@params,$value); next}
00208     if ($name eq '@') {push(@params,'['.join(',',$value,@args).']'); @args = (); last}
00209     if ($name =~ s/\[(\d+)\]$//) {
00210       $options{$name} = $default{$name} unless defined $options{$name};
00211       $options{$name}[$1] = $value; next;
00212     }
00213     $options{$name} = $value unless $value eq '""' || $value eq "''";
00214   }
00215   #
00216   #  Add the hash values to the new argument list
00217   #
00218   while (($name,$value) = each %options) {
00219     $value = '['.join(',',@{$options{$name}}).']' if ref($value) eq 'ARRAY';
00220     push(@options,"$name=>$value");
00221   }
00222   #
00223   #  Create the new function and display it
00224   #
00225   my $F = $f->[0].'('.join(', ',@params,@options,@args).')';
00226   unless ($quiet) {
00227     print stderr "   $original(",join(',',@{$args}),") -> $F\n";
00228     $changed = 1;
00229   }
00230   return $F;
00231 }
00232 
00233 #
00234 #  Get the argument list for the function, respecting quotation marks,
00235 #  nested parentheses, and so on.  Remove comments that might be
00236 #  nested within a multi-line function call.
00237 #
00238 sub GetArgs {
00239   my $text = shift;
00240   my @args = (); my $parenCount = 0; my $arg = "";
00241   return (undef,$text) unless $text =~ s/^\s*\(//; # remove leading spaces and opening paren
00242   $text = trimComments($text);
00243   while ($text =~ s/^((?:"(?:\\.|[^\"])*"|'(?:\\.|[^\'])*'|\\.|[^\\])*?)([(){}\[\],\n])//) {
00244     if ($2 eq '(' || $2 eq '[' || $2 eq '{') {$parenCount++; $arg .= $1.$2; next}
00245     if ($2 eq ')' && $parenCount == 0) {$arg .= $1; push(@args,trim($arg)); last}
00246     if ($2 eq ')' || $2 eq ']' || $2 eq '}') {$parenCount--; $arg .= $1.$2; next}
00247     if ($2 eq "\n") {$arg .= $1; $text = trimComments($text); next}
00248     if ($parenCount == 0) {
00249       push(@args,trim($arg.$1)); $arg = "";
00250       $text = trimComments($text);
00251     } else {$arg .= $1.$2}
00252   }
00253   $text =~ s/^ +//; # remove unneeded leading spaces
00254   return(\@args,$text);
00255 }
00256 
00257 #
00258 #  Process each file
00259 #
00260 push(@ARGV,"-") if (scalar(@ARGV) == 0);
00261 foreach $file (@ARGV) {print Process($file)}
00262 print stderr "\n";
